question_text: Which of the following best describes memory evolution from DDR2 to DDR5?
answer_options: Newer modules are always backward compatible.
Each version increased capacity and transfer speed.
DDR3 uses less power than DDR4.
DDR5 supports all earlier motherboard types.
correct_answer: Each version increased capacity and transfer speed
explanation: With each DDR generation, the memory technology improved in capacity and data transfer rates, but backward compatibility was not maintained.
